text: Visual Statistical Tests What is the p-value that the “true” mean of all female mice, not just our sample, is < 207 Because the highlighted region is outside of the 95% confidence interval, which contains 95% of the means, we know that the probability that the “true” mean is in this area has to be <0.05. Thus... The p-value < 0.05 - This is unlikely and we say there is a statistically significant difference.
